cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles SSE of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the central Gulf, then turning N-NW/N toward the Louisiana coast before accelerating N-NE inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast, roughly between Cameron and Grand Isle

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from High Island, TX to Grand Isle, LA; Storm Surge Watch from High Island, TX to the AL/FL border including Lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas and Borgne
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. coastal warnings yet (only Yucatán TS warning as of advisory)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward to the Alabama/Florida border, greatest impacts expected in Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (66% chance); a 28% chance exists for sustained 50-kt (58-mph) winds with higher gusts Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels in nearby Lake Maurepas and lower Mississippi River could rise 3–5 ft above ground; higher 4–7 ft values expected just south of the port along Vermilion-Atchafalaya bays.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals to 12 inches Friday–Saturday, producing flash and urban flooding concerns for port facilities and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible Friday–Friday night; dangerous river currents and debris on the Mississippi River may disrupt navigation.
